questions.article: Maryam Hosseini and her team used aerial images of well-mapped areas of Manhattan to train a computer program to identify sidewalks. When it was tested on images of Brooklyn, it ______ identified sidewalks in the vast majority of cases and even whether sidewalks were concrete or cobblestone. Hosseini believes the program will improve on this already-strong performance as it gets used more.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: reliably

options.name: B
options.content: clumsily

options.name: C
options.content: rarely

options.name: D
options.content: slowly

questions.correct: reliably

questions.article: The Chao Phraya River delta is a constantly changing landform made up of a network of distributaries, small channels that branch off from the main river. The delta is shaped and reshaped over time as sediments carried by the river ______ where the river meets the Gulf of Thailand, eventually forming new portions of land.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: accumulate

options.name: B
options.content: dissolve

options.name: C
options.content: accelerate

options.name: D
options.content: thrive

questions.correct: accumulate

questions.article: The Third-Class Carriage, painted in the realist style by Honoré Daumier, depicts working-class travelers in a third-class railway car. The realists’ emphasis on accurately portraying the experiences of average working people was largely a rejection of the romantic style evident in many paintings by Eugéne Emmanuel Amaury Pineux Duval, which instead ______ their subjects' beauty or heroism while hiding all imperfection.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: exaggerate

options.name: B
options.content: correct

options.name: C
options.content: undermine

options.name: D
options.content: mock

questions.correct: exaggerate

questions.article: The decline of the giant pika, a species found throughout northern North America before it became extinct around 8000 BCE, surely had a number of ______ the larger ecosystem in which it existed. The giant pika was part of a complex food web with other organisms, and its disappearance likely affected several other species.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: similarities to

options.name: B
options.content: precedents in

options.name: C
options.content: sources in

options.name: D
options.content: consequences for

questions.correct: consequences for

questions.article:
The following text is adapted from Pam Muñoz Ryan's 2020 novel Mañanaland. In the village where Max lives, there is an old fortress called La Reina. Children in the village say that the fortress is haunted.

For as long as he could remember, Max had begged Papa [his father] to take him to see La Reina and the ruins up close. He'd be a hero among his friends if he was the first boy to cross the haunted gates! Just because Papa didn't believe in ghosts didn't mean they weren't there. Maybe this summer Papa would finally take him. He was almost twelve.

©2020 by Pam Muñoz Ryan
questions.question: Which choice best describes the overall purpose of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: To show how much Max wants to visit La Reina

options.name: B
options.content: To portray how proud Max's father is of Max

options.name: C
options.content: To criticize Max for disliking summer

options.name: D
options.content: To explain why Max doesn't want to grow up yet

questions.correct: To show how much Max wants to visit La Reina

questions.article: Driven to sell as many paintings as possible, Alfred Hair, an influential figure among the landscape artists known as the Florida Highwaymen, pioneered "fast painting," a technique (which in part involved swift applications of paint) that many Highwaymen, including Isaac Knight, adopted. To conclude that this approach accounts for the ethereal qualities now synonymous with the Highwaymen aesthetic is tempting but inaccurate, as Hair's methods weren't universally practiced by his affiliates: Roy McLendon, for example, painted with greater deliberateness but achieved the same effects.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It details evidence that contradicts a claim mentioned earlier in the text about a long-standing disagreement within a group of artists.

options.name: B
options.content: It explains how an artist mentioned earlier in the text developed a distinctive style by adapting a particular approach to painting originated by his colleagues.

options.name: C
options.content: It considers and rebuts an interpretation of the effect of a painting technique mentioned earlier in the text on the perception of work by a group of artists.

options.name: D
options.content: It establishes a contrast between the aesthetic qualities of works by artists who were central to a movement introduced earlier in the text and those of an artist who was more peripheral to that movement.

questions.correct: It considers and rebuts an interpretation of the effect of a painting technique mentioned earlier in the text on the perception of work by a group of artists.

questions.article:
The following text is adapted from Daniel Defoe's 1704 nonfiction book The Storm.

The sermon is a sound of words spoken to the ear, and prepared only for present meditation, and extends no farther than the strength of memory can convey it; a book printed is a record; remaining in every man's possession, always ready to renew its acquaintance with his memory, and always ready to be produced as an authority or voucher to any reports he makes out of it, and conveys its contents for ages to come, to the eternity of mortal time, when the author is forgotten in his grave.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: It recounts why the works of some artists are still discussed by critics after the artists' deaths while others are not.

options.name: B
options.content: It analyzes the contributions to society of two different groups of scholars.

options.name: C
options.content: It demonstrates that one form of communication is more commonly used than another.

options.name: D
options.content: It describes differences in the characteristics of two kinds of communication.

questions.correct: It describes differences in the characteristics of two kinds of communication.

questions.article: In the 1960s, Gloria Richardson led a movement to promote racial equality. Her involvement in this effort was inspired by her daughter, Donna Richardson. In 1961, Donna joined protests organized by the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee in Cambridge, Maryland. Following her daughter, Gloria joined these protests too. Gloria soon became the Gloria of the Cambridge Nonviolent Action Committee. She was also the leader of what became known as the Cambridge movement.
questions.question: According to the text, what did Gloria Richardson lead?

options.name: A
options.content: A new business in Cambridge, Maryland

options.name: B
options.content: The Cambridge movement

options.name: C
options.content: Protests to support environmental protections

options.name: D
options.content: Her daughter Donna's high school

questions.correct: The Cambridge movement

questions.article: Spanning the 1920s to the 1980s, Mexican architect Luis Barragan's prolific career evolved through distinct phases. After traveling to the United States and Europe in the early 1930s and immersing himself in an international architectural discourse, Barragan began incorporating principles derived from functionalism and modernism in his work, as seen in the El Arenal Parish Church, whose unadorned geometric forms contrast with the historically inspired architecture found in the houses for Emiliano Robles León, one of Barragan's early projects in Guadalajara.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Barragan's designs of the El Arenal Parish Church and the houses for Emiliano Robles León are considered paragons of a functionalist and modernist aesthetic.

options.name: B
options.content: Barragan's design of the houses for Emiliano Robles León is considered more experimental than his design for the El Arenal Parish Church.

options.name: C
options.content: Barragan's early work shows an initial dedication to a modernist aesthetic that he later abandoned.

options.name: D
options.content: A notable shift in Barragan's design aesthetic reflects the influence of his time abroad.

questions.correct: A notable shift in Barragan's design aesthetic reflects the influence of his time abroad.

questions.article: Like many other bird species that live only on the Hawaiian archipelago, the Kaua'i 'amakihi has adapted to life in a well-defined habitat, resulting in highly specialized physical and behavioral characteristics that aid the species in survival. However, because the Kaua'i 'amakihi is highly specialized, it is especially vulnerable to environmental changes that can disrupt the delicately balanced ecosystem in which it lives.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: The Kaua'i 'amakihi is a species of bird that is related to many other Hawaiian birds but does not share a habitat with any of them.

options.name: B
options.content: The Kaua'i 'amakihi is an example of a highly specialized bird species found only on the Hawaiian archipelago and is related to several other highly specialized bird species found there.

options.name: C
options.content: The Kaua'i 'amakihi is an example of a species unique to the Hawaiian archipelago that is highly specialized and therefore particularly susceptible to habitat disturbances.

options.name: D
options.content: Hawaiian birds display a unique range of physical and behavioral characteristics and as a result can only live in habitats unique to the Hawaiian archipelago.

questions.correct: The Kaua'i 'amakihi is an example of a species unique to the Hawaiian archipelago that is highly specialized and therefore particularly susceptible to habitat disturbances.

questions.article: Over time, marine mollusks called nautilids continually add segments to their shells, and the chemical composition of each segment is influenced by the available materials in the surrounding water when the segment forms. Paleontologist Amane Tajika and colleagues analyzed the septa (the walls between shell chambers) of one male (samples labeled “M”) and one female (samples labeled "F") nautilid, finding that sample F07 had the same concentration of oxygen-18 as did water approximately 135 meters deep and that the oxygen-18 concentration in sample M24 matched that of water at approximately 370 meters deep. Tajika et al. concluded that sample F07 formed at a higher point in the water column than did M24.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly support the researchers' conclusion?

options.name: A
options.content: Among nautilids, there is no effect of sex on the uptake of oxygen-18 from water or its deposition in septa.

options.name: B
options.content: Male nautilids tend to show higher concentrations of oxygen-18 than do female nautilids inhabiting the same point in the water column.

options.name: C
options.content: In nautilids, sex predicts septa growth rate more strongly than does oxygen-18 concentration in the surrounding water.

options.name: D
options.content: Regardless of sex, nautilids spend most of their lives at depths of 50 meters or greater, where oxygen-18 concentrations typically differ from those higher in the water column.

questions.correct: Among nautilids, there is no effect of sex on the uptake of oxygen-18 from water or its deposition in septa.

questions.article: Cane is a 1923 novel by Jean Toomer. In the novel, Toomer mentions a road in rural Georgia called Dixie Pike and describes it as having a deep connection to a faraway place, writing, ________
questions.question: Which quotation from Cane most effectively illustrates the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: "And when the wind is from the South, soil of my homeland falls like a fertile shower upon the lean streets of [Washington, DC]."

options.name: B
options.content: "[Fern and I] walked down the [Dixie] Pike with people on all the porches gaping at us."

options.name: C
options.content: "The Dixie Pike has grown from a goat path in Africa."

options.name: D
options.content: "[The wagon] bumps, and groans, and shakes as it crosses the railroad track."

questions.correct: "The Dixie Pike has grown from a goat path in Africa."

questions.article: The Clouds is a 423 BCE play by Aristophanes, originally written in ancient Greek. At the time, professional intellectuals called sophists taught customers rhetorical techniques to use in public speaking, along with providing instruction in other subjects. In the play, Aristophanes satirizes sophists as teaching students how to be persuasive without regard for what is morally good, as seen when the character ______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses a quotation from a translation of The Clouds to illustrate the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: Socrates, a sophist, says that he studies astronomy while in a basket hanging a few feet off the ground because "I should not have rightly discovered things celestial if I had not suspended the intellect, and mixed the thought in a subtle form with its kindred air."

options.name: B
options.content: Strepsiades encourages his son to learn to be a sophist, saying, "Go, I entreat you, dearest of men, go and be taught."

options.name: C
options.content: Socrates, a sophist, says to a new customer "Come now: what do you now wish to learn first of those things in none of which you have ever been instructed?"

options.name: D
options.content: Strepsiades hires a sophist to teach his son and says to the sophist, "But see that he learns those two [styles of argument]; the better, whatever it may be; and the worse, which, by maintaining what is unjust, overturns the better. If not both, at any rate the unjust one by all means."

questions.correct: Strepsiades hires a sophist to teach his son and says to the sophist, "But see that he learns those two [styles of argument]; the better, whatever it may be; and the worse, which, by maintaining what is unjust, overturns the better. If not both, at any rate the unjust one by all means."

questions.article: The phrase omo-ropmo bilak is a past-oriented expression used by members of the Yupno, an Indigenous group in Papua New Guinea, that translates to "a couple of years ago." Rafael Nunez and colleagues recorded Yupno speakers explaining several of these temporal-related words and phrases and coded each speaker's manual gestures. Previous research has found evidence of Spanish speakers referring to the front/back axis to describe events in time, and many researchers believe that this tendency to make temporal distinctions along imagined linear axes is universal. However, Nunez and colleagues claim that this tendency is not in fact ubiquitous.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly support Nunez and colleagues' claim?

options.name: A
options.content: Yupno speakers typically use their left hand to make temporal gestures regardless of whether the gestures are past oriented or future oriented.

options.name: B
options.content: When outdoors and referring to the future, Yupno speakers facing uphill gesture in front of themselves, whereas those facing downhill gesture behind themselves.

options.name: C
options.content: Yupno speakers were observed making temporal gestures both indoors and outdoors, though with greater frequency when indoors.

options.name: D
options.content: Some Yupno grammatical structures used when talking about time is also used in Spanish.

questions.correct: When outdoors and referring to the future, Yupno speakers facing uphill gesture in front of themselves, whereas those facing downhill gesture behind themselves.

questions.article: Sheffield United Football Club won more than half its home matches between 1947 and 2003, helping to distinguish the team as a top British professional soccer club. Additionally, Sheffield United, whose home uniform color is mainly red, was more successful in home matches than was Cardiff City Football club, whose home uniform color is not red. Research has shown that many people associate the color red with power and dominance. Past experiences with red objects such as stop signs can even cause people to respond to the color red with caution and hesitation. These findings, if applicable in the context of athletic competitions, could suggest that in matches played at Sheffield United's home stadium, opponents may have ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: been unaffected by the red clothing worn by fans in the stadium.

options.name: B
options.content: played more aggressively than they would have if their own uniforms were red.

options.name: C
options.content: been influenced by the color of Sheffield United's uniforms.

options.name: D
options.content: been aware that Sheffield United's uniform color affected their own performance.

questions.correct: been influenced by the color of Sheffield United's uniforms.

questions.article: After he finally watched The Maltese Falcon (1941) at last year's annual film festival, the infamously disagreeable film critic wrote a scathing review. Before that, the film he least enjoyed ______ the more recent classic Slumdog Millionaire (2008).
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: has been

options.name: B
options.content: had been

options.name: C
options.content: is

options.name: D
options.content: was being

questions.correct: had been

questions.article: Inspired by her Ottawa/Pottawatomi/Ojibwe heritage, artist Kelly Church typically uses black ash—a durable and flexible ______ craft baskets that are both beautiful and whimsical.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: material: to

options.name: B
options.content: material; to

options.name: C
options.content: material—to

options.name: D
options.content: material. To

questions.correct: material—to

questions.article: New Mexico governor ______ the first woman to serve in that role in the state's history—took office on January 1, 2011.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: Susana Martinez,

options.name: B
options.content: Susana Martinez:

options.name: C
options.content: Susana Martinez

options.name: D
options.content: Susana Martinez—

questions.correct: Susana Martinez—

questions.article: The 1960 founding of the Mexican American Political Association and the 1946 Mendez v. Westminster court decision are regarded as important events in US civil rights ______ former establishing a Latino rights advocacy group and the latter legally affirming the rights of Latino students.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: history the

options.name: B
options.content: history, the

options.name: C
options.content: history, as the

options.name: D
options.content: history. The

questions.correct: history, the

questions.article: A government body officially known as the Althing, ______
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: 930 CE was the year when Iceland's parliament, one of the oldest parliaments in the world, first met.

options.name: B
options.content: the world's oldest parliaments include one which first met in 930 CE, Iceland's.

options.name: C
options.content: the first meeting of one of the oldest parliaments in the world, Iceland's, was in 930 CE.

options.name: D
options.content: Iceland's parliament is one of the oldest in the world, first meeting in 930 CE.

questions.correct: Iceland's parliament is one of the oldest in the world, first meeting in 930 CE.

questions.article: Trisyllabic words ______ as dactyls in English metrical verse, such as "devious" and "particle," consist of one stressed syllable followed by two unstressed syllables.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: classified

options.name: B
options.content: can be classified

options.name: C
options.content: are classified

options.name: D
options.content: have been classified

questions.correct: classified

questions.article: Soil polluted with manganese (a heavy metal) is harmful to many plants and animals, but the plant species Typha latifolia, or broadleaf cattail, not only thrives in such conditions but also helps remediate them. As a metal hyperaccumulator, Typha latifolia absorbs a large amount of manganese and stores it safely in its roots and shoots; ______ manganese concentrations in the soil decrease.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: nevertheless,

options.name: B
options.content: in addition,

options.name: C
options.content: in turn,

options.name: D
options.content: specifically,

questions.correct: in turn,

questions.article: When printing paper money for the colony of Pennsylvania in the 1730s, Benjamin Franklin—then a Philadelphia shop owner—took steps to combat the circulation of counterfeit notes, such as weaving blue threads and muscovite (a reflective mineral) into the paper he used. ______ he stamped the notes with detailed imprints of sage leaves that proved difficult for forgers to replicate.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: Moreover,

options.name: B
options.content: Specifically,

options.name: C
options.content: For example,

options.name: D
options.content: That said,

questions.correct: Moreover,

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The Massasoit National Wildlife Refuge (NWR) is a protected natural area in Massachusetts.
  • It encompasses 184 acres.
  • It was established to safeguard the habitat of the Plymouth red-bellied turtle, an endangered species.
  • The Massasoit NWR is managed by the US Fish & Wildlife Service.
  • The US Fish & Wildlife Service limits human activities in the area.
questions.question: The student wants to indicate the size of the Massasoit NWR. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: A protected natural area, the Massasoit NWR encompasses 184 acres of land in Massachusetts.

options.name: B
options.content: The Massasoit NWR is a protected natural area managed by the US Fish & Wildlife Service, which limits human activities there.

options.name: C
options.content: The Massasoit NWR is a natural area in Massachusetts, home to the Plymouth red-bellied turtle.

options.name: D
options.content: Home to the Plymouth red-bellied turtle, Massachusetts's Massasoit NWR is managed by the US Fish & Wildlife Service.

questions.correct: A protected natural area, the Massasoit NWR encompasses 184 acres of land in Massachusetts.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Oak Tree House is an Ancestral Puebloan dwelling site located in southwestern Colorado.
  • It was built under a rock overhang and inhabited from approximately 1180–1210 CE.
  • The overhanging rock ledges offered protection from heavy rain and snow.
  • Yucca House is an Ancestral Puebloan dwelling site located in southwestern Colorado.
  • It was built on relatively flat terrain and inhabited from approximately 1080–1275 CE.
  • This level surface allowed for the construction of large terraced buildings.
questions.question: The student wants to explain an advantage of the Oak Tree House dwelling site. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: The location of Oak Tree House, an Ancestral Puebloan dwelling site in southwestern Colorado, provided an advantage to its inhabitants.

options.name: B
options.content: Located in southwestern Colorado, Oak Tree House is an Ancestral Puebloan dwelling site that was inhabited from approximately 1180–1210 CE.

options.name: C
options.content: The relatively flat terrain on which Oak Tree House was built allowed for the construction of large terraced buildings.

options.name: D
options.content: Since it was built under a rock overhang, Oak Tree House was naturally protected from heavy rain and snow.

questions.correct: Since it was built under a rock overhang, Oak Tree House was naturally protected from heavy rain and snow.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The human tongue contains taste receptors for a rich, savory flavor called umami.
  • Umami is triggered by the compounds in a variety of foods, including tuna and soy sauce.
  • Participants in a study tasted a sample of sugar kelp, a type of brown seaweed.
  • They rated its umami intensity as moderate.
  • The participants tasted a sample of ma-konbu, another type of brown seaweed.
  • They rated its umami intensity as high.
questions.question: The student wants to emphasize a difference between the two seaweeds. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Some types of brown seaweed, like sugar kelp and ma-konbu, trigger umami flavor in human taste buds.

options.name: B
options.content: While sugar kelp and ma-konbu contain umami flavor, umami can also be found in tuna and soy sauce.

options.name: C
options.content: Although sugar kelp and ma-konbu are types of brown seaweed, the latter's umami flavor is more intense.

options.name: D
options.content: Sugar kelp is a type of brown seaweed, but so is ma-konbu.

questions.correct: Although sugar kelp and ma-konbu are types of brown seaweed, the latter's umami flavor is more intense.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
  • The A.M. Turing Award is a prestigious award given by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM).
  • The ACM gives the award for “major contributions of lasting importance to computing.”
  • Shafi Goldwasser won the award in 2012 for transformative work that laid the foundations for digital cryptography.
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses information from the given sentences to emphasize when Shafi Goldwasser won the A.M. Turing Award?

options.name: A
options.content: For transformative work that laid the foundations for digital cryptography, Shafi Goldwasser won the A.M. Turing Award.

options.name: B
options.content: It was in 2012 that Shafi Goldwasser won the A.M. Turing Award.

options.name: C
options.content: Shafi Goldwasser is one winner of the A.M. Turing Award.

options.name: D
options.content: The prestigious A.M. Turing Award is given for “major contributions of lasting importance to computing.”

questions.correct: It was in 2012 that Shafi Goldwasser won the A.M. Turing Award.
